sen.e: Nagakiyo OGASAWARA was a military commander from Kai Province who lived in the last days of the Heian period to the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 高倉天皇に滝口武者として仕えた父・加賀美遠光の所領のうち、甲斐国巨摩郡小笠原郷を相続して、元服の折に高倉天皇より小笠原の姓を賜ったとされる。
sen.e: It is said that he succeeded to Ogasawarago, Koma district, Kai Province among the territory of his father Tomitsu Kagami who served the Emperor Takakura as the Imperial Palace Guards and that he was granted the family name of Ogasawara from the Emperor Takakura when the time came to celebrate his coming of age.

sen.j: 源頼朝挙兵時は、兄・秋山光朝とともに京都で平知盛の被官であったとされ、母の病気を理由に帰国を願い出て許され、源頼朝の下に参じたと伝えられる。
sen.e: It is said that when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo raised his army, he was a hikan (a low-level bureaucrat) of TAIRA no Tomonori together with Mitsutomo AKIYAMa, his older brother, and they joined Yoritomo's army by having the authorization from Tomonori to return home under the pretext of their mother's becoming sick.

sen.e: In addition, along with Nobumitsu TAKEDA, Yukiuji UNNO and Shigetaka MOCHIZUKI, he was called as 'the big four in the archery and equestrianism' and he became the grand master of Kyuho (manners in time of peace and campaign strategy in times of war; Japanese horse-back archery technique) founded by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo when he was 26 years old; with these activities he built the base of Ogasawara clan as shogunal retainer of the Kamakura Shogunate.

sen.j: 頼朝の没後、子の弥太郎長経が二代将軍源頼家の近習であった事から、比企能員の変に連座して処罰されたため一時小笠原氏は没落するが、承久の乱で東山道の大将軍の一人として「七ケ国管領」となり功績を挙げ、承久3年（1221年）に阿波国守護となる。
sen.e: After Yoritomo died, his son having been an attendant of the second Shogun MINAMOTO no Yoriie, Nagakiyo was implicated in the Rebellion of Yoshikazu HIKI and accordingly he was punished; owing to this incident, Ogasawara clan fell at one time, but he became the 'deputy of the seven provinces' as one of the Daishogun (commander in chief) of Tosando and made great contribution to the Jokyu War; thanks to this achievement he became the Awa no kuni shugo (provincial constable of Awa Province) in 1221.
